questions.question: They didn't allow me ................................ the hall.
questions.description: Allow is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: She didn't let me .................................. her room.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You ought ..................................... a doctor.
questions.description: Ought is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: He is able ..................................... on his hands.
questions.description: Able is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: She can ................................... with both hands.
questions.description: Can is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: They made us ................................. for hours.
questions.description: Wait is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I forgot ..................................... the letters.
questions.description: Forget is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I saw him .................................. the road.
questions.description: See is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I heard her ................................... on the phone.
questions.description: Hear is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You needn't ................................... for me.
questions.description: When need is a modal auxiliary, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You don't need .................................... for that call.
questions.description: When need is an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.
